channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Six Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Trump’s Ukraine peace plan endangered by his launch of a new war in the western hemisphere, saber rattling over Greeland
item.description: Leaders of Ukraine’s allies gathered Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country’s security after any potential peace deal.

item.title: Pizza plummeted on the list of Americans’ favorite take-out options as they opt for more nutrient-dense slop bowls from Uber Eats
item.description: Even when customers choose pizza, they tend to get smaller pies and fewer toppings, said Papa John’s executives.

item.title: 5 Years After Jan. 6, Lawlessness Has Triumphed
item.description: Tragically, America is still living in a political era that began on Jan. 6, 2021.

item.title: Doug LaMalfa Is Dead: Republican Congressman From California Was 65
item.description: Mr. LaMalfa had represented a district in northeastern California since 2013.

item.title: Meet an Oregon cafe where American Sign Language is the default way to order
item.description: The cafe — owned by CymaSpace, a nonprofit that makes art accessible to the Deaf community — also hosts weekly ASL meetups and game nights.

item.title: How the ‘Donroe Doctrine’ Reinforces Xi’s Vision of Power in Asia
item.description: The U.S. assault on Venezuela points to a world where big powers seek to call the shots in their regions, an idea Beijing knows well.

item.title: Air traffic still runs on floppy discs in places, so the FAA just picked 2 companies for a $26 billion radar overhaul
item.description: The FAA has been spending most of its $3 billion equipment budget just maintaining the fragile old system.

item.title: Syria and Israel Revive Security Talks Mediated by the U.S.
item.description: The talks, in Paris, are the latest effort to reduce tensions between two longstanding enemies. A deal would help both curry favor with the Trump admi...

item.title: Trump Mobile has been accepting $100 deposits for a golden phone but the prototype is nowhere to be seen as CES kicks off
item.description: Trump Mobile initially hailed T1 as a device that would be “proudly designed and built in the United States for customers who expect the best."

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Six Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Machado Says She Plans to Return to Venezuela ‘as Soon as Possible’
item.description: María Corina Machado, Venezuela’s opposition leader, said she was planning to return to the country after the United States’ capture of Nicolás Maduro...

item.title: 2026 Travel Destinations: 52 Places to Go This Year
item.description: Our list for the new year features an eclipse, a revolution and a tiger reserve. What’s on yours?

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Suggests Extended U.S. Involvement in Venezuela
item.description: President Trump told NBC News that the United States must “nurse the country back to health” before elections can be held there, and named a group of ...

item.title: Map: 5.7-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Japan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
